column20: 3 = mod. hypomimia, lips parted some of time
column21: 4 = masked or fixed face, lips parted 1/4 of inch or more with complete loss of expression

column2: Arising From Chair (pt. arises with arms folded across chest)
column18: 1 = slow, may need more than one attempt
column19: 2 = pushes self up from arms or seat
column20: 3 = tends to fall back, may need multiple tries but can arise without assistance

column18: 1 = slightly stooped, could be normal for older person
column19: 2 = definitely abnormal, mod. stooped, may lean to one side
column20: 3 = severely stooped with kyphosis
column21: 4 = marked flexion with extreme abnormality of posture

column18: 1 = walks slowly, may shuffle with short steps, no festination or propulsion
column19: 2 = walks with difficulty, little or no assistance, some festination, short steps or propulsion
column20: 3 = severe disturbance, frequent assistance

column18: 1 = recovers unaided
column19: 2 = would fall if not caught
column20: 3 = falls spontaneously

column18: 1 = minimal slowness, could be normal, deliberate character
column19: 2 = mild slowness and poverty of movement, definitely abnormal, or dec. amp. of movement
column20: 3 = moderate slowness, poverty, or small amplitude
